org.jtimer

Class Runner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtimer.Runner

  • public class Runner
extends java.lang.Object
    The brains behind everything I'd say. This is what times methods, adds timeout to methods, adds the data to a graph, recursively finds all methods inside a package, etc. It does a lot and I should probably split things up a bit just to make it look better. To get a more detailed look at what the runner does make sure to look at the time method.
    Author:
    MagneticZero
    See Also:
    time(String, TimeMethod)

      An interface used to change how things are timed.

      A annotation map of methods that the runner will execute.

      The timer to track timeout.

    • Method Detail

      • time

        public static void time(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Runs all @Time methods inside of the Class cls. See Runner.time(String, TimeMethod) for a more detailed method that does the same thing.
        Parameters:
        cls - The class that contains the things you want to time
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - This could be a number of things, although most things should be already handeled by the Runner, there's a special case though if the Exception is a InvocationTargetException then the Runner will unwrap the exception beforehand and then throw that.
        See Also:
        time(String, TimeMethod)

      • time

        public static void time(java.lang.Class<?> cls,
                        Runner.TimeMethod timeMethod)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Runs all @Time methods inside of the Class cls using a specified TimeMethod. See Runner.time(String, TimeMethod) for a more detailed method that does the same thing.
        Parameters:
        cls - The class that contains the things you want to time
        timeMethod - The functional interface for timing however you want
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - This could be a number of things, although most things should be already handeled by the Runner, there's a special case though if the Exception is a InvocationTargetException then the Runner will unwrap the exception beforehand and then throw that.
        See Also:
        time(String, TimeMethod)

      • time

        public static void time(java.lang.String pkg)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Runs all @Time methods inside of the package pkg. See Runner.time(String, TimeMethod) for a more detailed method that does the same thing.
        Parameters:
        pkg - The package name that contains the things you want to time
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - This could be a number of things, although most things should be already handeled by the Runner, there's a special case though if the Exception is a InvocationTargetException then the Runner will unwrap the exception beforehand and then throw that.
        See Also:
        time(String, TimeMethod)

      • time

        public static void time(java.lang.String pkg,
                        Runner.TimeMethod timeMethod)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        This will execute all methods found in the timing package, although if the String pkg ends with .class, it will only do the following on that class. If the class has a @Warmup then all methods with the @Time will be executed by the runner a predefined amount of times. The order of operations is anything with a @BeforeClass which is only once. Then @Before is executed before each @Time, just like JUnit @Time will execute followed by @After. Lastly @AfterClass is executed after all @Time have been executed.
        Parameters:
        pkg - The package name that contains the things you want to time
        timeMethod - The functional interface for timing however you want
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - This could be a number of things, although most things should be already handeled by the Runner, there's a special case though if the Exception is a InvocationTargetException then the Runner will unwrap the exception beforehand and then throw that. And now with the creation of PopupDialogue exceptions will be logged and saved so that they can be uploaded and further analyzed. The exceptions will still be thrown, so catching and handling will be still be up to the user.

      • getGrapher

        public static Grapher getGrapher()
        Returns the grapher being used so that the user can set the graph settings.
        Returns:
        The graph being used

      • await

        public static void await()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Provides a method that allows one to wait for the runner to execute all things that need timing if they want to execute more things after it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the latch throws an InterruptedException

      • warmup

        private static void warmup(java.lang.Object obj,
                           Runner.TimeMethod timeMethod)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                           java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                           java.lang.SecurityException,
                           java.lang.InterruptedException
        Executed to warmup all the methods and your CPU, if you want. The class needs the @Warmup annotation present in order for this to be run. If present, it will run all @Time annotated methods the defined amount of times. This also handles all the class static variables by keeping track of them and resetting them after the warmup has been executed back to the initial values. It basically does all the same things Runner.time(String).
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to use
        timeMethod - The functional interface for timing however you want
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the proper arguments are not given
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If a method/field is not accessible
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If the method called throws an exception
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If a field doesn't exist
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the security manager throws an exception
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the latches/barriers throw an exception

      • runWithTimeout

        private static java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch runWithTimeout(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                                                  Runner.TimeMethod timeMethod,
                                                                  javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Number> data,
                                                                  long i,
                                                                  long timeout,
                                                                  java.lang.Object obj,
                                                                  boolean warmup)
        Runs a method with a given timeout.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to run
        timeMethod - The time method to use to time it
        data - The series to add the data to
        i - The current repetition
        timeout - The timeout, in milliseconds
        obj - The object to execute to use
        warmup - If this is a warmup
        Returns:
        A countdown latch so that the timer can wait

      • graphData

        private static void graphData(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                              javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Number> chart,
                              long x,
                              long y)
                       throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                              java.lang.SecurityException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Internal method used to add data to the graph.
        Parameters:

        chart - The chart to add the data to
        x - The x component
        y - The y component
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If the field doesn't exist
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the security managers runs into a security violation
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When a method doesn't have the given arguments
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When the reflector cannot access something

      • graphFinish

        private static void graphFinish(boolean bestFit)
                         throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                java.lang.SecurityException,
                                java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Finishes a graph by executing the Grapher.finish(boolean) method.
        Parameters:
        bestFit - Whether or not the best fit function should be calculated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If the field doesn't exist
        java.lang.SecurityException - If there is a Security Manager encounters something
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the method doesn't exist
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If you're not allowed to access something
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the arguments given are not correct
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If you're invoking the method on an incorrect object
